description: From French d√©capiter, from Late Latin decapitare, from de- + caput.

verbs.description: decapitate (third-person singular simple present decapitates, present participle decapitating, simple past and past participle decapitated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, literally) To remove the head of.
(transitive, figurative) To oust or destroy the leadership or ruling body of (a government etc.).
